```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```
## Dependencies

```{r deps}
library(ggplot2)
library(devtools)
```


## Installing accessrmd

```{r instgithub, eval=FALSE}

install_github("datasciencecampus/accessrmd")

```


```{r accessrmd}
library(accessrmd)
```


## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=TRUE}
plt <- ggplot(pressure, aes(x = temperature, y = pressure)) +
  geom_point()

access_img(plt, alt = "temperature vs pressure in base R pressure dataset.")
```

Note that the `echo = TRUE` parameter was added to the code chunk to print the R code that generated the plot.</body>
